LinearEntity¶

class decodes.core.dc_line.LinearEntity(a, b)¶

Bases: decodes.core.dc_base.Geometry

A linear entity (line, ray, segment, etc) in space.

Warning

This is an abstract class and is not meant to be instantiated.

__init__(a, b)¶

LinearEntity Constructor.

Parameters:
  • a (Point) – Starting point.
  • b (Point or Vector) – Second point or Vector.
Result :

LinearEntity object.
Return type:

LinearEntity
angle_between(l1, l2)¶

Returns an angle formed between the two linear entities.

Parameters:
  • l1 (LinearEntity) – First LinearEntity
  • l2 (LinearEntity) – Second LinearEntity
Result :

Angle in radians.
Return type:

float

Note

Description of Method: From the dot product of vectors v1 and v2 it is known that:

dot(v1, v2) = |v1|*|v2|*cos(A)

where A is the angle formed between the two vectors. We can get the directional vectors of the two lines and readily find the angle between the two using the above formula.

Warning

This method is not implemented.

Return type:Point
is_concurrent(*lines)¶
Returns True if the set of linear entities are concurrent, False
otherwise. Two or more linear entities are concurrent if they all
intersect at a single point.
Parameters:lines – a set of LinearEntities
Result :
Return type:

Note

Description of Method: First, take the first two lines and find their intersection. If there is no intersection, then the first two lines were parallel and had no intersection so concurrency is impossible amongst the whole set. Otherwise, check to see if the intersection point of the first two lines is a member on the rest of the lines. If so, the lines are concurrent.

Warning

This method is not implemented.

near(p)¶

Returns a tuple of the closest point to a given LinearEntity, its t value and the distance from the Point to the near Point.

Parameters:p (Point) – Point to look for a near Point on the LinearEntity.
Result :Tuple of near point on LinearEntity, t value and distance from point to near point.
Return type:(Point, float, float)

parallel_line(p)¶

Returns a new Line which is parallel to this linear entity and passes through the specified point.

Parameters:p (Point) – Point that the LinearEntity will pass through.
Result :New LinearEntity.
Return type:LinearEntity

Result :New LinearEntity.

This method is not implemented.

perpendicular_segment(p)¶

Returns a new Segment which connects p to a point on this linear entity and is also perpendicular to this line. Returns p itself if p is on this linear entity.

Parameters:p (Point) – Point that the LinearEntity will pass through.
Result :New LinearEntity.
Return type:LinearEntity

Warning

This method is not implemented.
